papers.title: Nanocrystal Quantum Dots: From Discovery to Modern Development
papers.abstract_snippet: This review traces nanocrystal quantum dot (QD) research from the early discoveries to the present day and into the future. We describe the extensive body of theoretical and experimental knowledge that comprises the modern science of QDs. Indeed, the spatial confinement of electrons, holes, and excitons in nanocrystals, coupled with the ability of modern chemical synthesis to make complex designed structures, is today enabling multiple applications of QD size-tunable electronic and optical properties.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Provides comprehensive historical and technical context for quantum dot development, including display applications like Samsung's QLED TVs mentioned in search results[3][7].

papers.title: Highly efficient printed quantum dot light-emitting diodes through ultrahigh-definition double-layer transfer printing of a QD/ZnO film
papers.abstract_snippet: Presents a breakthrough in QLED manufacturing achieving 23.3% external quantum efficiency through novel transfer printing techniques, demonstrating wearable display applications and ultra-high 20,526 PPI resolution.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Directly addresses quantum dot display technology advancements with specific metrics matching search result descriptions of modern QLED capabilities[4][7][14].
